oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Statler Brothers - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews the Statler Brothers (musicial group). The episode was set to air for the week of January 16, 1989. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Statler Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Statler Brothers Pulsebeat show -- (00:38) Moon, Pretty Moon (Statler Brothers) -- (02:57) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (03:12) Spangler asks Phil Balsley about the first time the Statler Brothers sang together -- (04:02) Atlanta Blue (Statler Brothers) -- (06:47) Spangler and Balsley reflect on the large meanings of tiny moments in stardom -- (08:00) Spangler and an unidentified member of the Statler Brothers reflect on the historical nature of the Statler Brothers -- (08:48) More Than a Name on the Wall (Statler Brothers) -- (11:35) Spangler expresses her surprise in the Statler Brother's unanimous decision making when it comes to choosing a song -- (12:14) Still (Bill Anderson) -- (14:59) An unidentified voice performs a John Willingham Barbeque commercial spot -- (16:39) Am I Crazy (Statler Brothers) -- (19:55) Spangler introduces Jimmy Fortune to reflect on the writing of "Elizabeth" -- (20:54) Elizabeth (Statler Brothers) -- (24:17) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Statler Brothers;
